JobTitle: Portfolio Manager - Opportunity for Working Remotely
JobFullDesc: The Elevator Pitch: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?Working with HR Planning and Operations Team (HRPO), you will engage with Senior HR Leadership in the planning, design, and deployment of our most critical, high-impact, and transformational people programs and business solutions. Through coaching and influence, you will partner with and enable our HR Centers of Excellence (COE) organization and business enablement teams to develop high-impact, scalable, customer-centric solutions that enable the success and growth of our VMware business. If you are flexible, action-oriented, well organized, a self-starter, and passionate about program management, change management, continuous improvement, and enabling others to succeed, then this is the opportunity for you.Success in the Role: What are the performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?Manage a portfolio of HR initiatives, programs, and projects that support our new HR operating model:Within 30 days of employment:  become competent in VMware’s business guidelines, our new HR Operating model, our HR Planning and Operations Solution Delivery model, and standard operationsWithin 60 days of employment:  you will be managing a dedicated HR Portfolio including the coordination of quarterly/annual planning activities, supporting one or more HR Business Enablement Team(s), and be responsible for helping to resolve issues and eliminate barriersWithin 180 days, you will be identifying and acting on opportunities that address gaps and help increase communication, collaboration, and alignment across our HR Portfolios and business enablement teams; plan and lead our quarterly HR Live sessions, and be responsible for continuous improvement and innovation in one or more HR Planning & Operation priority areas (customer feedback, release readiness, etc.)Throughout your first yea,  you will be taking advantage of opportunities to learn and grow your career by scheduling regular development discussions with your manager, learning about other HR COE areas of interest, volunteering to work on other exciting HR projects and initiatives, attending one of our many learning sessions or development-related events offered, expanding your global network, and much moreThe Work: What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?The HRPO Team is responsible for helping our HR Business Area Leads, COE Leaders, and COE project teams deliver customer-centric solutions that solve business needs. In this role you will:Partner closely with both our HR Business Area and COE Leaders to understand goals and priorities, helping them to identify business implications across various projects and portfolios, and assist with quarterly planning, change management, and readinessBe a trusted advisor to COE project teams as they design, build and release solutions to the business. You will coach them through the full HR project delivery lifecycle, ensuring they leverage key HR design principles and change management to ensure overall successWhere needed, dig into the details of a project to get a full understanding, rolling it up into a simplified, executive-level explanation and connecting the dots for how it intersects and supports other projects and programsUse various collaboration tools and resources such as MS Teams, Smartsheets, Microsoft Office, Miro, and PowerBIAs part of our team’s “continuous improvement” focus, identify and help to continually simplify our processes, tools, and resourcesWhat is the leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?The hiring manager for this role, Jonathan Biard, has two roles both as a Director for our HR Planning and Operations Team (HRPO) and is the Chief of Staff to the HR Leadership Team. His management style is about encouraging and growing each team member to apply her/his expertise in every situation, being a servant leader who is always available to coach and support his team regularly, acknowledging small and big wins.There are 5 amazing people on our team. 3 team members are Portfolio Managers on our team, each supporting an HR Priority Portfolio and a Business Enablement Team, and you will be the fourth when you join. 2 team members are Project Managers, each support a specific HR COE area and their key projects. Although our team is small, our scope is strategic and broad, and includes supporting work happening across the entire HR organization (and often touching the whole company). We are currently distributed across Palo Alto, Austin and Bellevue.Where is the role located?This role is remote and will not be assigned to a fixed office location. This means it can be done anywhere as long as there is a strong internet connection and limited distractions. VMware has a policy to empower employees with choice to work from wherever they will be the most productive and healthy, whether that be at home, a VMware office, or a coffee shop. As the world continues to open up again, there may a opportunity to travel 1-2 times a year to collaborate face-to-face with the team or COE project teams.What are the benefits and perks of working at VMware?You and your loved ones will be supported with a competitive and comprehensive benefits package.
